string-array.name: atomQuestion
string-array.item: What information is necessary to determine the atomic mass of the element Chlorine?
An atom of aluminum in the ground state and an atom of gallium in the ground state have the same

string-array.name: atomExplaination
string-array.item: The atomic mass of an atom, in this case Chlorine, is calculated by multiplying the masses of each chlorine isotope by its percent abundance and then dividing by 100. This gives you the weighted atomic mass, which number is found on the periodic table.
Aluminum and Gallium are both found in group 13, which contains 3 valence electrons, therefore they both have 3 valence electrons on their outer shell.

string-array.name: atomChoiceA
string-array.item: a. the atomic mass of each artificially produced isotope of chlorine, only

string-array.name: atomChoiceB
string-array.item: b. the relative abundance of each naturally occurring isotope of chlorine, only

string-array.name: atomChoiceC
string-array.item: c. the atomic mass and the relative abundance of each naturally occurring isotope of chlorine

string-array.name: atomChoiceD
string-array.item: d. the atomic mass and the relative abundance of each naturally occurring and artificially produced isotope of chlorine
d. total number of valence electrons

string-array.name: collQuestion
string-array.item: The relatively high boiling point of water is due to having

string-array.name: collExplaination
string-array.item: Hydrogen bonding is an intermolecular interaction that plays a role in causing water to have a high boiling point and a low freezing point due to the attraction between the positively charged hydrogen atoms and the negatively charged oxygen atoms.

string-array.name: acidQuestion
string-array.item: Which substance is always a product when an Arrhenius acid in an aqueous solution reacts with an Arrhenius base in an aqueous solution?

string-array.name: acidExplaination
string-array.item: An acid and a base undergo the process of neutralization, therefore always producing water (H2O)

string-array.name: orgQuestion
string-array.item: What is the meaning of...organic chem?

string-array.name: orgExplaination
string-array.item: Ethanol is an alcohol and dimethyl ether is an ether.
